title: Smirnoff ad face - Life Is Calling. Where are you?
content:
Hi there, does anyone know what font has been used for this? i need to match it for a design i'm working on.   
thanks in advance - Kathy ![Life is Calling](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073623im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/49505.jpg)
author: kaff

comments.content:
Hi Kathy, can you tell us where is the sample from?   
   
It smells like "custom-corporate-face" to me.

Could this be the work of [Rian Hughes](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073623/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/fontsearch.php?q=paralucent&ss=2)? Or maybe [Christian Schwartz](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073623/http:/www.orangeitalic.com/fonts/index.html)?

Hm, was about to post this as a new type ID as the font caught my eye at the bus stop today.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073623im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Smirnoff_Flavours_ad_image_LIME_5717.jpg)
  
It's very cool in a kind of Schwartz way but he lists his custom work on [his own website](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073623/http:/christianschwartz.com/munich.shtml), where this doesn't appear. Maybe someone has an idea?

Well some online research has led me to [Threeview](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073623/http:/www.threebrand.com/page/Smirnoff_Lime.aspx) agency in Edinburgh, who seem to be responsible for the latest ad campaign. I've just e-mailed to see if they can tell us the designer.

EDIT: Nailed it! Just discovered it is the work of a [Jesse Ragan](http://web.archive.org/web/20141113073623/http:/www.jesseragan.com/work-smirnoff.html) commissioned in 2003 through H&FJ, called Smirnoff. Nice work, Jesse.

I would say, nice work Ben, to track that one down. I hope I can remember that answer, because this seems like something that we may get over and over.

- Mike Yanega
Thanks Mike, I figured the answer had to be somewhere and Google is very handy! :)
